doc.previous: In 1939 with Germany s invasion of France looming Mir relocated to Varengeville in Normandy and on 20 May of the following year as Germans invaded Paris he narrowly fled to Spain now controlled by Francisco Franco for the duration of the Vichy Regime s rule 15 In Varengeville Palma and Mont roig between 1940 and 1941 Mir created the twenty three gouache series Constellations Revolving around celestial symbolism Constellations earned the artist praise from Andr Breton who seventeen years later wrote a series of poems named after and inspired by Mir s series 16 Features of this work revealed a shifting focus to the subjects of women birds and the moon which would dominate his iconography for much of the rest of his career
doc.after: Shuzo Takiguchi published the first monograph on Mir in 1940 In 1948 49 Mir lived in Barcelona and made frequent visits to Paris to work on printing techniques at the Mourlot Studios and the Atelier Lacouri re He developed a close relationship with Fernand Mourlot and that resulted in the production of over one thousand different lithographic editions
